Description: Fragment of rim and wall of North Ionian pottery bowl with handle roots; interior: key maeander between bands at rim; lotus flower and bud frieze to the centre, with added red; band with added red band at the break; exterior slipped cream; pendant lotus flower between handle roots, with rosettes, spirals and leaves to either side; below, band with added red band lined in white; frieze of goats grazing to left (much of one, horn of second).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.112)
